intro: Pyrola magna, commonly known as the large piedmont pink, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features broad, waxy leaves and produces showy, pinkish-white flowers in late spring. It thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts.
